commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level 1 Features to the Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
The Chatbot should be able to interact with the user.

To achieve that, the first step done is to echo back what
the user enters.

The Chatbot would shutdown when the
user inputs "bye"(Case Sensitivity is taken care of).

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level 2 Features to the chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
It would be good if we can store the user entered
inputs, and the user could view those any
time he would like to do so.

Add an List<String> to store the various
user inputs. Register some keywords
including "bye" and "list" to terminate
the session with the chatbot and to view
the items present in the list respectively.

List<String> is used as we can store
almost infinite inputs versus how arrays
would restrict to a certain number that has
to be determined at the start of the program.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level 3 features to the Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
To make the chatbot more functional, and to help
you through your daily chores, this chatbot can now
keep a track of various tasks you have.

A new class called Task is added to help track the
task status(whether done or not). Also, the ability to
mark tasks as done is added.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level 4 features to the Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
There are various types of tasks including but
not limited to events, deadlines and todos.
The chatbot should be able to serve the end user
better and be more functional.

Extracting the common behaviour into a super class,
called "Task" allows to use polymorphism when dealing
with various types of tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add A-TextUiTesting Level Features to Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
A Chatbot should provide appropriate response. This
implies, we shall do enough testing of the Chatbot.

Performed Testing on the Chatbot and updated
.gitignore file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level 5 features to the Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
The Chatbot should not crash at any instance if
an invalid/unformatted input is entered by the user.
It should instead inform the user to use the right
format and perhaps show an error message as well.

Custom exceptions are made to take care of various
scenarios where a user might enter a wrong input.

Also updated input and EXPECTED text files for
testing purpose.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level 6 Features to the Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
The scenario where the user enters task details
and makes some mistake, or if the user has decided
not to do the task on that particular day, he/she can delete
the task.

Added a delete functionality to allow users to delete tasks.

Updated testing files accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level 8 features to the Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
Timing is something that the bot needs to
be aware of. Representing it merely as String
makes our life easy as developers, but in terms
of functionality, it doesn't help.

Therefore, a custom class is added to handle
date and it's format.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level 7 features to the Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
For the chatbot to be functional, it
should be able to store users previous
tasks. Even on relaunching the bot, it
shall showcase all the previous tasks
user had, whether accomplished or not.

Add a Storage class to help implement this
functionality using a text file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Alter the Task representation in text file
commitResults.messageBody:
Since date also used '/', there were problems
in parsing the Task when read from a file.

Change '/' to '|' for Task representation in Text file.

In the Retriever chatbot, most of the code
is in the main - Retriever class.

The goal is to refactor the code to extract out
closely related code as classes to make the
code more OOP.

Add various classes including Ui, Storage,
Parser and TaskList.

The files were all organised in one
folder. Searching for files was becoming
complex as the number of files kept on
increasing.

Add packages. Organize the files into
exception, task, and retriever packages
respectively.

To avoid naming conflicts and
to make it easier to search for various files,
packaging has been implemented.

Delete the files that have been
reorganized into various packages.

Testing is an integral part of programming
apps. It is done to ensure the smooth running
of a program.

Add JUnit Test classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level-9 feature to the Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
When the task list grows considerably in
size, it becomes hard to look for tasks.

Add find feature.

This allows to look up for a task with
a given keyword.

Following a coding standard is necessary
as it makes the code look well formatted and
enhances readability.

Refine the code according to the
given Java coding standard.

Documentation helps others to understand
what your code is trying to do.

Add JavaDoc comments.

Testing is important. It ensures that
your program delivers what you
expect from it.

Made changes to runtest.sh file and other
files that help to test the chatbot.

Some other files have also been added and
deleted.

Removed some unused methods from
Task.java file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Gradle support to the Chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
Added Gradle to automate various build
tasks and testing of the Chatbot project

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak code to follow new code style
commitResults.messageBody:
After adding checkStyle, some coding style
violations were detetcted.

Hence, these have been fixed.

Having a good interaction medium, that is,
a Graphical User Interface(GUI) to interact
with the chatbot is a must. It also
improves the usability of the app.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix Text Truncate Issues for Larger Text
Add quit functionality to the Chatbot
Update code to create a new JAR file
Update files to improve GUI support
commitResults.messageBody:
A GUI was added to the Chatbot, and therefore
the CLI based U.I. became obsolete. Consequently,
there is a need to remove the dead code.

Remove various lines of code that help run the
CLI version of the Chatbot.

This would enhance the code quality.

Improved the Welcome Splash screen
visuals.

The code works at the moment; however, the code might be a bit
messy or unclear at specific instances.

The code needs to be refactored as this would improve the
readability, and also simplify various complex expressions
present.

Refactor the code as per the Code Quality guide.

The guide is being followed to refactor to adhere to the coding
standards set up in this module.

The code works fine. However, there is a risk of it crashing due to
some assumptions that we made during writing the program to become
false during the execution.

Add Assertions at various places to verify that the assumptions made
are true.

Assertions are being adopted because they help define assumptions about
the program state so the runtime can verify them.

The chatbot is relatively easy to use once you get the hang of it.
However, for a new user, it might be a daunting task to find out
more about the commands available, and how to use them.

Add a help page, which shows a list of commands available and
how to use them.

The most intuitive way of looking for help would be by typing help
in the text field.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update welcome splash screen to show help message

commitResults.messageBody:
The users can view the tasks by using the list command. It allows them
to see which tasks they have completed and which they haven't.

The users need more power and flexibility to be able to view the
tasks they have to do by the end of a particular day.

Add view command that lets the users look at the tasks due on a
particular day.

The ability to specify the date helps the user to customize the
command.
Made subtle changes to the way date is handled and checked.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak code to follow code style
Add background color to dialog box

commitResults.messageBody:
It is important to showcase the messages in
a organised manner.

Tweak the GUI to match the asymmetric nature
of the conversation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak code to follow code style
Tweak code to follow code style

commitResults.messageBody: README.md updated to show the User Guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update JUnit Test Case for UiTest
